snippet.title: Ikiki Games Gallery - Part 21: Teppoman (てっぽマン)
snippet.description:
In this video series I will chronologically explore all games released by the independent japanese developer known as "Ikiki". The games range from more and less elaborate action games to highly obscure minigames, all varying in scope and quality. Though, they usually have two things in common: They are entertaining and creative, and some are true gems of indie games.


Teppoman, from March 5, 2003, is Ikiki's first clearly larger action game, and the foundation for several more advanced titles, including one of his very best games, the direct sequel Teppoman 2 (See Part 44). The basic gameplay is fairly simple, as you don't have any special moves. But, you can pick up different weapons, and levels require a bit of strategy to beat. You also need to free all hostages in order to progress past the first boss. Overall it is good, but gets very hard.
Download it here: http://ikiki.la.coocan.jp/himoji/game.htm (look for date "2003/03/05", filename "teppoman.zip")

-Controls:
Arrow keys: Move
Shift: Jump / Start game
Ctrl: Punch / Shoot
Down: Pick up items / Open chests / Free hostages
Hold Down: Lock aiming direction
X: Drop weapon
J: Suicide
F2: Restart


-Software used:
Recording: CamStudio
Editing: VirtualDub
